solution_line_template: Before the Wednesday discount, the cost of the jean is ${final_cost_after_all_discounts} + ${wednesday_discount_amount} = $<<{final_cost_after_all_discounts}+{wednesday_discount_amount}={cost_before_wednesday_discount}>>{cost_before_wednesday_discount}.

Since the original price was reduced by 50%, the original cost for the jeans is ${cost_before_wednesday_discount} * {multiplier_for_original_cost} = $<<{cost_before_wednesday_discount}*{multiplier_for_original_cost}={original_cost}>>{original_cost}.
